slokas: धृतराष्ट्र उवाचधर्मक्षेत्रे कुरुक्षेत्रे समवेता युयुत्सव: ।मामका: पाण्डवाश्चैव किमकुर्वत सञ्जय ॥ १ ॥
slokas_translated: King Dhritarashtra said, "On the field of righteousness, the Kurukshetra, the warriors are assembled, eager for battle. Tell me, Sanjaya, what are my sons and the Pandavas doing?"

slokas: सञ्जय उवाचदृष्ट्वा तु पाण्डवानीकं व्यूढं दुर्योधनस्तदा ।आचार्यमुपसङ्गम्य राजा वचनमब्रवीत्  ॥  २ ॥
slokas_translated: Sanjaya said, "Seeing the Pandava army arrayed, Duryodhana approached his teacher and spoke these words."

slokas: पश्यैतां पाण्डुपुत्राणामाचार्य महतीं चमूम् ।व्यूढां द्रुपदपुत्रेण तव शिष्येण धीमता ॥ ३ ॥
slokas_translated: "Look, O teacher, at this mighty army of the sons of Pandu, arrayed by your brilliant disciple, the son of Drupada."

slokas: अत्र श‍ूरा महेष्वासा भीमार्जुनसमा युधि ।युयुधानो विराटश्च द्रुपदश्च महारथः ॥ ४ ॥
slokas_translated: "Here are mighty heroes, strong in archery, like Bhima and Arjuna in battle: Yuyudhana, Virata, and the great warrior Drupada."

slokas: धृष्टकेतुश्चेकितानः काशिराजश्च वीर्यवान् ।पुरुजित्कुन्तिभोजश्च शैब्यश्च नरपुङ्गवः ॥ ५ ॥
slokas_translated: "Dhrishtaketu, Chekitana, the valiant king of Kashi, Purujit, Kunti-bhoja, and the best of men, Saibya."

slokas: युधामन्युश्च विक्रान्त उत्तमौजाश्च वीर्यवान् ।सौभद्रो द्रौपदेयाश्च सर्व एव महारथाः ॥ ६ ॥
slokas_translated: "Yudhamanyu, the valiant, the strong and powerful Uttamaujas, the son of Subhadra, the sons of Draupadi, all great warriors."

slokas: अस्माकं तु विशिष्टा ये तान्निबोध द्विजोत्तम ।नायका मम सैन्यस्य संज्ञार्थ तान्ब्रवीमि ते ॥ ७ ॥
slokas_translated: "But, O best of Brahmanas, know those who are distinguished among us, the leaders of my army. I will tell you their names."

slokas: भवान्भीष्मश्च कर्णश्च कृपश्च समितिंजयः ।अश्वत्थामा विकर्णश्च सौमदत्तिस्तथैव च ॥ ८ ॥
slokas_translated: "Bhishma, Karna, Kripa, the conqueror of enemies, Aswatthama, Vikarna, and also Saumadatti."

slokas: अन्ये च बहवः श‍ूरा मदर्थे त्यक्तजीविताः ।नानाशस्त्रप्रहरणाः सर्वे युद्धविशारदाः ॥ ९ ॥
slokas_translated: "And many other brave warriors, who have given up their lives for my sake.  They are all skilled in warfare, wielding various weapons."

slokas: अपर्याप्त‍ं तदस्माकं बलं भीष्माभिरक्षितम् ।पर्याप्त‍ं त्विदमेतेषां बलं भीमाभिरक्षितम् ॥ १० ॥
slokas_translated: "Our army, though protected by Bhishma, is insufficient. But this army of theirs, protected by Bhima, is sufficient."

slokas: अयनेषु च सर्वेषु यथाभागवमस्थिताः ।भीष्ममेवाभिरक्षन्तु भवन्तः सर्व एव हि ॥ ११ ॥
slokas_translated: "Let all of you, according to your respective divisions, be stationed in all the formations. Protect Bhishma, all of you."

slokas: तस्य सञ्जनयन्हर्षं कुरुवृद्धः पितामहः ।सिंहनादं विनद्योच्च‍ैः शङ्खं दध्मौ प्रतापवान् ॥ १२ ॥
slokas_translated: "To gladden Sanjaya, the grandsire of the Kuru lineage, the mighty Bhishma, roaring like a lion, blew his conch."

slokas: ततः शङ्खाश्च भेर्यश्च पणवानकगोमुखाः ।सहसैवाभ्यहन्यन्त स शब्दस्तुमुलोऽभवत् ॥ १३ ॥
slokas_translated: "Then, conch shells, kettle-drums, tabors, and trumpets, all were sounded at once, and a tremendous uproar arose."

slokas: ततः श्वेतैर्हयैर्युक्ते महति स्यन्दने स्थितौ ।माधवः पाण्डवश्चैव दिव्यौ शङ्खौ प्रदध्मतुः ॥ १४ ॥
slokas_translated: "Then, seated in their great chariots drawn by white steeds, Madhava (Krishna) and the son of Pandu (Arjuna) blew their divine conch shells."

slokas: पाञ्चजन्यं हृषीकेशो देवदत्तं धनञ्जयः ।पौण्ड्रं दध्मौ महाशङ्खं भीमकर्मा वृकोदरः ॥ १५ ॥
slokas_translated: "Hrishikesha (Krishna) blew the Panchajanya, Dhananjaya (Arjuna) the Devadatta, and the mighty Bhimakarma (Bhima) blew the Paundra."

slokas: अनन्तविजयं राजा कुन्तीपुत्रो युधिष्ठिरः ।नकुलः सहदेवश्च सुघोषमणिपुष्पकौ ॥ १६ ॥
slokas_translated: "The king, the son of Kunti, Yudhisthira, blew the Anantavijaya. Nakula and Sahadeva blew the Sughosa and the Manipushpaka respectively."

slokas: काश्यश्च परमेष्वास: शिखण्डी च महारथ: ।धृष्टद्युम्न‍ो विराटश्च सात्यकिश्‍चापराजित: ॥ १७ ॥
slokas_translated: "Kashiraja (King of Kashi), the supreme archer, Shikhandi, the great warrior, Dhristadyumna, Virata, and the unconquerable Satyaki."

slokas: द्रुपदो द्रौपदेयाश्च सर्वश: पृथिवीपते ।सौभद्रश्च महाबाहु: शङ्खान्दध्मु: पृथक्पृथक् ॥ १८ ॥
slokas_translated: "Drupada, the sons of Draupadi, all the kings of the earth, and the mighty-armed son of Subhadra, each blew their own conch shells."

slokas: स घोषो धार्तराष्ट्राणां हृदयानि व्यदारयत् ।नभश्च पृथिवीं चैव तुमुलोऽभ्यनुनादयन् ॥ १९ ॥
slokas_translated: "That sound pierced the hearts of the Kauravas, and resounded loudly through the sky and the earth."

slokas: अथ व्यवस्थितान्दृष्ट्वा धार्तराष्ट्रान्कपिध्वजः ।प्रवृत्ते शस्त्रसम्पाते धनुरुद्यम्य पाण्डवः ।हृषीकेशं तदा वाक्यमिदमाह महीपते ॥ २० ॥
slokas_translated: "Seeing the Kauravas arrayed in battle formation, Arjuna, with the banner of a monkey, took up his bow as the weapons were about to clash. Then, he spoke these words to Hrishikesha (Krishna), the lord of the earth."

slokas: अर्जुन उवाचसेनयोरुभयोर्मध्ये रथं स्थापय मेऽच्युत ।यावदेतान्निरीक्षेऽहं योद्‍धुकामानवस्थितान् ॥ २१ ॥
slokas_translated: Arjuna said: "O Achyuta (Krishna), place my chariot between the two armies, so that I may view these warriors who are eager to fight."

slokas: कैर्मया सह योद्धव्यमस्मिन्‍रणसमुद्यमे ॥ २२ ॥
slokas_translated: "Who, along with me, must be fought in this battle."

slokas: योत्स्यमानानवेक्षेऽहं य एतेऽत्र समागताः ।धार्तराष्ट्रस्य दुर्बुद्धेर्युद्धे प्रियचिकीर्षवः ॥ २३ ॥
slokas_translated: "I wish to see those who have gathered here to fight, who are desirous of pleasing the wicked Duryodhana in this battle."

slokas: सञ्जय उवाचएवमुक्तो हृषीकेशो गुडाकेशेन भारत ।सेनयोरुभयोर्मध्ये स्थापयित्वा रथोत्तमम् ॥ २४ ॥
slokas_translated: Sanjaya said: "Thus addressed by Gudakesha (Arjuna), Hrishikesha (Krishna), the best of charioteers, placed his chariot between the two armies."

slokas: भीष्मद्रोणप्रमुखतः सर्वेषां च महीक्षिताम्  ।उवाच पार्थ पश्यैतान्समवेतान्कुरुनिति ॥ २५ ॥
slokas_translated: "And seeing Bhishma, Drona, and all the kings assembled there, Krishna said to Partha (Arjuna): 'See, here are the assembled Kurus.'"

slokas: तत्रापश्यत्स्थितान्पार्थः पितॄनथ पितामहान्।आचार्यान्मातुलान्भ्रातॄन्पुत्रान्पौत्रान्सखींस्तथा।श्वश‍ुरान्सुहृदश्चैव सेनयोरुभयोरपि ॥ २६ ॥
slokas_translated: "There, Arjuna saw his fathers, grandfathers, teachers, uncles, brothers, sons, grandsons, friends, fathers-in-law, and well-wishers on both sides of the army."

slokas: तान्समीक्ष्य स कौन्तेयः सर्वान्बन्धूनवस्थितान्  ।कृपया परयाविष्टो विषीदन्निदमब्रवीत् ॥ २७ ॥
slokas_translated: "Seeing them all, the sons of Kunti, overwhelmed with compassion, became sorrowful and spoke these words."

slokas: अर्जुन उवाचदृष्ट्वेमं स्वजनं कृष्ण युयुत्सुं समुपस्थितम्  ।सीदन्ति मम गात्राणि मुखं च परिश‍ुष्यति ॥ २८ ॥
slokas_translated: Arjuna said: "O Krishna, seeing this kin of mine, eager to fight, standing before me, my limbs tremble and my mouth dries up."

slokas: वेपथुश्च शरीरे मे रोमहर्षश्च जायते ।गाण्डीवं स्रंसते हस्तात्त्वक्च‍ैव परिदह्यते ॥ २९ ॥
slokas_translated: "My body trembles, and my hair stands on end. My bow Gandiva slips from my hand, and my skin burns."

slokas: न च शक्न‍ोम्यवस्थातुं भ्रमतीव च मे मनः ।निमित्तानि च पश्यामि विपरीतानि केशव ॥ ३० ॥
slokas_translated: "I am unable to stand, and my mind seems to wander. O Keshava (Krishna), I see adverse omens."

slokas: न च श्रेयोऽनुपश्यामि हत्वा स्वजनमाहवे ।न काङ्क्षे विजयं कृष्ण न च राज्यं सुखानि च ॥ ३१ ॥
slokas_translated: "I do not see any benefit in slaying my own kin in battle. Nor do I desire victory, Krishna, nor dominion, nor happiness."

slokas: किं नो राज्येन गोविन्द किं भोगैर्जीवितेन वा ।येषामर्थे काङ्‍‍क्षितं नो राज्यं भोगाः सुखानि च ॥ ३२  ॥
slokas_translated: "What is the use of a kingdom, O Govinda, what is the use of pleasures, what is the use of life itself, for the sake of whom we desire kingdom, pleasures, and happiness?"

slokas: त इमेऽवस्थिता युद्धे प्राणांस्त्यक्त्वा धनानि च ।आचार्याः पितरः पुत्रास्तथैव च पितामहाः ॥ ३3॥
slokas_translated: "These, standing in battle, have abandoned their lives and their wealth: teachers, fathers, sons, and grandfathers."

slokas: मातुलाः श्वश‍ुराः पौत्राः श्यालाः सम्बन्धिनस्तथा ।एतान्न हन्तुमिच्छामि घ्न‍तोऽपि मधुसूदन ॥ ३४ ॥
slokas_translated: "Uncles, fathers-in-law, grandsons, brothers-in-law, and other relatives—even if they are killing me, I do not wish to slay them, O Madhusudana (Krishna)."

slokas: अपि त्रैलोक्यराज्यस्य हेतोः किं नु महीकृते ।निहत्य धार्तराष्ट्रान्नः का प्रीतिः स्याज्ज‍नार्दन ॥ ३५ ॥
slokas_translated: "Even for the sake of the sovereignty of the three worlds, what happiness would I have, O Janardana (Krishna), by killing the Kauravas?"

slokas: पापमेवाश्रयेदस्मान्हत्वैतानाततायिनः ।तस्मान्नार्हा वयं हन्तुं धार्तराष्ट्रान्सबान्धवान् ।स्वजनं हि कथं हत्वा सुखिनः स्याम माधव ॥ ३६ ॥
slokas_translated: "By killing these aggressors, we would incur sin. Therefore, we are not worthy of killing the Kauravas, all our kinsmen. How can we, O Madhava, be happy by slaying our own people?"

slokas: यद्यप्येते न पश्यन्ति लोभोपहतचेतसः ।कुलक्षयकृतं दोषं मित्रद्रोहे च पातकम् ॥ ३७
slokas_translated: "Although these men, blinded by greed, do not see the sin of destroying their family, and the crime of betraying friends..."

slokas: ॥कथं न ज्ञेयमस्माभिः पापादस्मन्निवर्तितुम् ।कुलक्षयकृतं दोषं प्रपश्यद्भ‍िर्जनार्दन ॥ ३८ ॥
slokas_translated: "...How can we, O Janardana, who see the sin of destroying our family, not know how to turn away from it?"

slokas: कुलक्षये प्रणश्यन्ति कुलधर्माः सनातनाः ।धर्मे नष्टे कुलं कृत्स्नमधर्मोऽभिभवत्युत ॥ ३९ ॥
slokas_translated: "When a family is destroyed, its eternal familial duties perish. When righteousness is destroyed, the entire family is destroyed, and unrighteousness overwhelms it."

slokas: अधर्माभिभवात्कृष्ण प्रदुष्यन्ति कुलस्त्रियः ।स्त्रीषु दुष्टासु वार्ष्णेय जायते वर्णसङ्करः ॥ ४० ॥
slokas_translated: "O Krishna, when unrighteousness prevails, the women of the family become corrupted. And when women are corrupted, O Varshneya (Krishna), caste-mixing arises."

slokas: सङ्करो नरकायैव कुलघ्न‍ानां कुलस्य च ।पतन्ति पितरो ह्येषां लुप्तपिण्डोदकक्रियाः ॥ ४१ ॥
slokas_translated: "Caste-mixing is a sure path to hell for the destroyers of their family and for the family itself. The ancestors of such men, deprived of offerings and libations, fall into hell."

slokas: दोषैरेतैः कुलघ्न‍ानां वर्णसङ्करकारकैः ।उत्साद्यन्ते जातिधर्माः कुलधर्माश्च शाश्वताः ॥ ४२ ॥
slokas_translated: "These sins of the destroyers of their family, causing caste-mixing, corrupt the eternal traditions and duties of their lineage."

slokas: उत्सन्नकुलधर्माणां मनुष्याणां जनार्दन ।नरके नियतं वासो भवतीत्यनुश‍ुश्रुम ॥ ४३ ॥
slokas_translated: "O Janardana, it is heard that those who abandon the duties of their lineage are destined to dwell in hell."

slokas: अहो बत महत्पापं कर्तुं व्यवसिता वयम् ।यद्राज्यसुखलोभेन हन्तुं स्वजनमुद्यताः ॥ ४४ ॥
slokas_translated: "Alas! How great a sin we are about to commit, by being eager to kill our own people for the sake of the pleasures of a kingdom."

slokas: यदि मामप्रतीकारमशस्त्रं शस्त्रपाणयः ।धार्तराष्ट्रा रणे हन्युस्तन्मे क्षेमतरं भवेत् ॥ ४५ ॥
slokas_translated: "If the Kauravas were to kill me in battle, unarmed and defenseless, it would be better for me."

slokas: सञ्जय उवाचएवमुक्त्वार्जुनः संख्ये रथोपस्थ उपाविशत् ।विसृज्य सशरं चापं शोकसंविग्न‍मानसः ॥ ४६ ॥
slokas_translated: Sanjaya said: "Having said this, Arjuna, in the midst of the Kurukshetra battlefield, sat down in his chariot, having abandoned his bow with arrows, his mind overwhelmed with grief."
